title: Sampler, 19th century
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on cotton foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross and marking cross stitches on plain weave foundation
provenance:
By 19??, American Art Galleries
19?? - 1981, Gertrude M. Oppenheimer
1981, Cooper-Hewitt Museum
description:
Bands of alphabets separated by narrow geometric borders, with the inscription:
M A Tolwell Aged 8
At the bottom, houses and a tree.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 19th century.
19th century. Medium: silk embroidery on cotton foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross and marking cross stitches on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Gertrude M. Oppenheimer. 1981-28-143.
